thread.title: Tourist arrivals in Zimbabwe rise by 7% in first half of 2015Travelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Tourist arrivals in Zimbabwe rise by 7% in first half of 2015Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Tourist arrivals in Zimbabwe rise by 7% in first half of 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Tourist arrivals in Zimbabwe rise by 7% in first half of 2015 Published  
Buoyed by an increase in visitors from Africa, tourist arrivals in Zimbabwe rose seven per cent in the first half of this year to 930,276 compared with the same period last year.According to the Zimbabwe Tourism Authority (ZTA), 867,163 tourists visited the country between January and June last year.
Arrivals from mainland Africa registered 811,717 foreign tourist arrivals, up from 745,566 in 2014 representing a nine percent increase, ZTA cited.The tourism body said arrivals from all other major markets except Oceania had, however, declined. Arrivals from Oceania were up 26 per cent to 14,567, accounting for two per cent of the market share.
Visitors from Asia declined by eight per cent to 15 000 while those from Europe- mainly from France, Germany, Italy and Spain — were down one per cent to 60,021 during the period.Arrivals from the Americas slumped 11 per cent to 27,117 while the Middle East registered the biggest decline, at 33 per cent.Chinese tourist arrivals increased by 46 per cent during the period under review. “Research has shown that 81 per cent of the Chinese arrivals entered through Harare International Airport, followed by Victoria Falls border with six per cent, Victoria Falls airport with five per cent and Kazungula with three percent,” the ZTA said.
